apiresponse.2002: Poll interval must be greater zero!
apiresponse.2004: The frequency must be set between {min} and {max} kHz and must be a multiple of 250kHz!
apiresponse.4002: Name must between 1 and {max} characters long!
apiresponse.4006: Invalid amount of max channel setting given!
apiresponse.7001: MQTT Server must between 1 and {max} characters long!
apiresponse.7002: Username must not longer then {max} characters!
apiresponse.7003: Password must not longer then {max} characters!
apiresponse.7004: Topic must not longer then {max} characters!
apiresponse.7005: Topic must not contain space characters!
apiresponse.7007: Port must be a number between 1 and 65535!
apiresponse.7008: Certificate must not longer then {max} characters!
apiresponse.7009: LWT topic must not longer then {max} characters!
apiresponse.7010: LWT topic must not contain space characters!
apiresponse.7011: LWT online value must not longer then {max} characters!
apiresponse.7012: LWT offline value must not longer then {max} characters!
apiresponse.7013: Publish interval must be a number between {min} and {max}!
apiresponse.7014: Hass topic must not longer then {max} characters!
apiresponse.7015: Hass topic must not contain space characters!
apiresponse.7016: LWT QOS must not greater then {max}!
apiresponse.7017: Client ID must not longer then {max} characters!
apiresponse.8006: Administrative AccessPoint Timeout value is invalid
apiresponse.9001: NTP Server must between 1 and {max} characters long!
apiresponse.9002: Timezone must between 1 and {max} characters long!
apiresponse.9003: Timezone description must between 1 and {max} characters long!
apiresponse.9004: Year must be a number between {min} and {max}!
apiresponse.9005: Month must be a number between {min} and {max}!
apiresponse.9006: Day must be a number between {min} and {max}!
apiresponse.9007: Hour must be a number between {min} and {max}!
apiresponse.9008: Minute must be a number between {min} and {max}!
apiresponse.9009: Second must be a number between {min} and {max}!
apiresponse.10001: Password must between 8 and {max} characters long!
apiresponse.12001: Profil must between 1 and {max} characters long!

home.LimitHint: Hint: If you set the limit as absolute value the display of the current value will only be updated after ~4 minutes.
home.LoadingInverter: Waiting for data... (can take up to 10 seconds)

vedirecthome.PowerLimiterState: Power limiter state [off (charging), solar passthrough, on battery]

devinfo.NoInfoLong: Did not receive any valid data from the inverter till now. Still trying...
devinfo.UnknownModel: Unknown model! Please report the "Hardware Part Number" and model (e.g. HM-350) as an issue here.

gridprofile.Name: Name
gridprofile.GridprofileSupportLong: Please see here for further information.

firmwareinfo.FirmwareVersionHint: Click here to show information about your current version
firmwareinfo.FirmwareUpdateHint: Click here to view the changes between your version and the latest version
firmwareinfo.FrmwareUpdateAllow: By activating the update check, a request is sent to GitHub.com each time the page is called up to retrieve the currently available version. If you do not agree with this, leave this function deactivated.

mqttinfo.HassSummary: Home Assistant MQTT Auto Discovery Configuration Summary

maintenancereboot.RebootQuestion: Do you really want to reboot the device?
maintenancereboot.RebootHint: Note: A manual reboot does not normally have to be performed. OpenDTU performs any required reboot (e.g. after a firmware update) automatically. Settings are also adopted without rebooting. If you need to reboot due to an error, please consider reporting it at Github.

dtuadmin.SerialHint: Both the inverter and the DTU have a serial number. The DTU serial number is randomly generated at the first start and does not normally need to be changed.
dtuadmin.NrfPaLevelHint: Used for HM-Inverters. Make sure your power supply is stable enough before increasing the transmit power.
dtuadmin.CmtPaLevelHint: Used for HMS/HMT-Inverters. Make sure your power supply is stable enough before increasing the transmit power.
dtuadmin.CmtCountryHint: Each country has different frequency allocations.
dtuadmin.CmtFrequencyHint: Make sure to only use frequencies that are allowed in the respective country! After a frequency change, it can take up to 15min until a connection is established.
dtuadmin.CmtFrequencyWarning: The selected frequency is outside the allowed range in your selected region/country. Make sure that this selection does not violate any local regulations.

securityadmin.PasswordHint: Hint: The administrator password is used to access this web interface (user 'admin'), but also to connect to the device when in AP mode. It must be 8..64 characters.
securityadmin.ReadOnly: Allow readonly access to web interface without password

ntpadmin.TimeServerHint: The default value is fine as long as OpenDTU has direct access to the internet.
ntpadmin.SunSetTypeHint: Affects the day/night calculation. It can take up to one minute until the new type will be applied.
ntpadmin.SynchronizeTimeHint: Hint: You can use the manual time synchronization to set the current time of OpenDTU if no NTP server is available. But be aware, that in case of power cycle the time gets lost. Also note that time accuracy will be skewed badly, as it can not be resynchronised regularly and the ESP32 microcontroller does not have a real time clock.

networkadmin.HostnameHint: Hint: The text %06X will be replaced with the last 6 digits of the ESP ChipID in hex format.
networkadmin.ApTimeoutHint: Time which the AccessPoint is kept open. A value of 0 means infinite.

mqttadmin.EnableHass: Enable Home Assistant MQTT Auto Discovery
mqttadmin.UsernameHint: Username, leave empty for anonymous connection
mqttadmin.PasswordHint: Password, leave empty for anonymous connection
mqttadmin.BaseTopicHint: Base topic, will be prepend to all published topics (e.g. inverter/)
mqttadmin.LwtTopicHint: LWT topic, will be append base topic
mqttadmin.LwtOnlineHint: Message that will be published to LWT topic when online
mqttadmin.LwtOfflineHint: Message that will be published to LWT topic when offline
mqttadmin.HassParameters: Home Assistant MQTT Auto Discovery Parameters
mqttadmin.HassPrefixTopicHint: The prefix for the discovery topic

vedirectadmin.UpdatesOnly: Publish values to MQTT only when they change

powermeteradmin.typeSML: SML/OBIS via serial connection (e.g. Hichi TTL)
powermeteradmin.typeHTTP_SML: HTTP(S) + SML (e.g. Tibber Pulse via Tibber Bridge)
powermeteradmin.jsonPathExamplesExplanation: The following paths each find the value '123.4' in the respective example JSON.
powermeteradmin.valueJsonPathDescription: Application specific JSON path to find the power value in the JSON payload, e.g., 'power/total/watts' or simply 'total'.
powermeteradmin.valueSignInvertedHint: Is is expected that positive values denote power usage from the grid. Check this option if the sign of this value has the opposite meaning.
powermeteradmin.testHttpJsonRequest: Send HTTP(S) request(s) and process response(s)
powermeteradmin.testHttpSmlRequest: Send HTTP(S) request and process response

httprequestsettings.urlDescription: URL must start with 'http://' or 'https://'. Characters like spaces and '=' have to be URL-encoded (%xx). Warning: SSL server certificate check is not implemented (MITM attacks are possible)!
httprequestsettings.headerKeyDescription: Optional. A custom HTTP header key-value pair can be defined. Useful, e.g., to send an (additional) authentication token.

powerlimiteradmin.ConfigAlertMessage: One or more prerequisites for operating the Dynamic Power Limiter are not met.
powerlimiteradmin.ConfigHintsIntro: The following notes regarding the Dynamic Power Limiter (DPL) configuration shall be considered:
powerlimiteradmin.ConfigHintPowerMeterDisabled: Without a power meter interface, the inverter limit the DPL will configure equals the configured base load (exception: (full) solar-passthrough).
powerlimiteradmin.ConfigHintNoInverter: At least one inverter must be configured prior to setting up the DPL.
powerlimiteradmin.ConfigHintInverterCommunication: Polling data from and sending commands to all managed inverters must be enabled.
powerlimiteradmin.ConfigHintNoChargeController: The solar-passthrough feature can only be used if the VE.Direct interface is configured.
powerlimiteradmin.ConfigHintNoBatteryInterface: SoC-based thresholds can only be used if a battery communication interface is configured.
powerlimiteradmin.SolarPassthroughLossesInfo: Hint: Line losses are to be expected when transferring energy from the solar charge controller to the inverter. These losses can be taken into account to prevent the battery from gradually discharging in (full) solar-passthrough mode. The power limit to be set on the inverter is additionally reduced by this factor after taking its efficiency into account.
powerlimiteradmin.BatteryDischargeAtNight: Use battery at night even if only partially charged
powerlimiteradmin.SolarpassthroughInfo: This feature allows to use the available current solar power directly. The solar power, as reported by the MPPT charge controller, is set as the inverter's limit, even if the battery is currently charging. This avoids storing energy unnecessarily, which would be lossy.
powerlimiteradmin.TargetPowerConsumptionHint: Grid power consumption the limiter tries to achieve. Value may be negative.
powerlimiteradmin.TargetPowerConsumptionHysteresisHint: Only send a newly calculated power limit to the inverter if the absolute difference to the last reported power limit exceeds this amount.
powerlimiteradmin.LowerPowerLimitHint: This value must be selected so that stable operation is possible at this limit. If the inverter could only be operated with a lower limit, it is put into standby instead.
powerlimiteradmin.BaseLoadLimitHint: Relevant for operation without power meter or when the power meter fails. As long as the other conditions allow (in particular battery charge), this limit is set on the inverter.
powerlimiteradmin.UpperPowerLimitHint: The inverter is always set such that no more than this output power is achieved. This value must be selected to comply with the current carrying capacity of the AC connection cables.
powerlimiteradmin.FullSolarPassthroughStartThresholdHint: Inverter power is set equal to Victron MPPT power (minus efficiency factors) while above this threshold. Use this if you want to supply excess power to the grid when the battery is full.
powerlimiteradmin.BatterySocInfo: Hint: The battery SoC (State of Charge) values are only used if the battery communication interface reported SoC updates in the last minute. Otherwise the voltage thresholds will be used as fallback.
powerlimiteradmin.InverterIsBehindPowerMeterHint: Enable this option if the power meter reading is reduced by the inverter's output when it produces power. This is typically true.
powerlimiteradmin.InverterIsSolarPowered: Inverter is powered by solar modules
powerlimiteradmin.UseOverscalingToCompensateShadingHint: Allow to overscale the inverter limit to compensate for shading of one or multiple inputs
powerlimiteradmin.VoltageLoadCorrectionInfo: Hint: When the battery is discharged, its voltage drops. The voltage drop scales with the discharge current. In order to not stop the inverter too early (stop threshold), this load correction factor can be specified to calculate the battery voltage if it was idle. Corrected voltage = DC Voltage + (Current power * correction factor).
powerlimiteradmin.InverterRestartHint: The daily yield of the inverter is usually reset at night when the inverter turns off due to lack of light. To reset the daily yield even though the inverter is continuously powered by the battery, the inverter can be automatically restarted daily at the desired time.

batteryadmin.MqttJsonPathDescription: Application specific JSON path to find the value in the JSON payload, e.g., 'electricLevel'. Leave empty if the topic's payload contains a plain numeric value.
batteryadmin.BatteryReportedDischargeCurrentLimitInfo: Hint: The lowest limit will be applied, with the battery-reported discharge current limit used only if an update was received in the last minute; otherwise, the previously specified limit will act as a fallback.
batteryadmin.ZendureDeviceIdDescription: The product ID has to be read manually via bluetooth
batteryadmin.ZendureAutoShutdownDescription: If no charge voltage is available, the battery managent system will be shutdown after reaching the minimum charge level
batteryadmin.ZendureForceLimitDescription: Also use given output power as setpoint. WARNING: This prevents dynmic control!

inverteradmin.Name: Name
inverteradmin.AddHint: Hint: You can set additional parameters after you have created the inverter. Use the pen icon in the inverter list.
inverteradmin.StatusHint: Hint: The inverter is powered by its DC input. If there is no sun, the inverter is off. Requests can still be sent.
inverteradmin.InverterNameHint: Here you can specify a custom name for your inverter.
inverteradmin.StringNameHint: Here you can specify a custom name for the respective port of your inverter.
inverteradmin.StringMaxPowerHint: Enter the max power of the connected solar panels.
inverteradmin.StringYtOffsetHint: This offset is applied the read yield total value from the inverter. This can be used to set the yield total of the inverter to zero if a used inverter is used. But you can still try polling data.
inverteradmin.InverterHint: *) Enter the W<sub>p</sub> of the channel to calculate irradiation.
inverteradmin.ReachableThresholdHint: Defines how many requests are allowed to fail until the inverter is treated is not reachable.
inverteradmin.ZeroRuntimeHint: Zero runtime data (no yield data) if inverter becomes unreachable.
inverteradmin.ZeroDayHint: This only works if the inverter is unreachable. If data is read from the inverter, it's values will be used. (Reset only occours on power cycle)
inverteradmin.DeleteMsg: Are you sure you want to delete the inverter "{name}" with serial number {serial}?
inverteradmin.YieldDayCorrectionHint: Sum up daily yield even if the inverter is restarted. Value will be reset at midnight

configadmin.RestoreHint: Note: This operation replaces the configuration file with the restored configuration and restarts OpenDTU to apply all settings.
configadmin.ResetHint: Note: Click Restore Factory-Default Settings to restore and initialize the factory-default settings and reboot.
configadmin.ResetMsg: Are you sure you want to delete the current configuration and reset all settings to their factory defaults?

firmwareupgrade.NoOtaSupport: This platform does not support OTA updates. New firmware can be written to flash memory using the USB interface.
firmwareupgrade.OtaSuccess: The firmware upload was successful. The device was restarted automatically. When the device is accessible again, the interface is automatically reloaded.

about.DocumentationBody: The canonical firmware and hardware documentation is accessible at https://opendtu-onbattery.net.
about.ProjectOriginBody1: OpenDTU-OnBattery is a fork of OpenDTU. The upstream project OpenDTU was started from this discussion. (Mikrocontroller.net)
about.ProjectOriginBody2: The Hoymiles protocol was decrypted through the voluntary efforts of many participants. OpenDTU, among others, was developed based on this work. The project is licensed under an Open Source License (GNU General Public License version 2).
about.ProjectOriginBody3: The software was developed to the best of our knowledge and belief. Nevertheless, no liability can be accepted for a malfunction or guarantee loss of the inverter.
about.ProjectOriginBody4: OpenDTU is freely available. If you paid money for the software, you probably got ripped off.
about.NewsUpdatesBody: New updates can be found on Github.
about.ErrorReportingBody: Please report issues using the feature provided by Github.
about.DiscussionBody: Discuss with us on Discord or Github.

hints.RadioProblem: Could not connect to a configured radio module. Please check the wiring.
hints.TimeSync: The clock has not yet been synchronised. Without a correctly set clock, no requests are made to the inverter. This is normal shortly after the start. However, after a longer runtime (>1 minute), it indicates that the NTP server is not accessible.
hints.DefaultPassword: You are using the default password for the web interface and the emergency access point. This is potentially insecure.

deviceadmin.ProfileHint: Your device may stop responding if you select an incompatible profile. In this case, you must perform a deletion via the serial interface.
deviceadmin.PowerSafeHint: Turn off the display if no inverter is producing.
deviceadmin.ScreensaverHint: Move the display a little bit on each update to prevent burn-in. (Useful especially for OLED displays)
deviceadmin.DiagramDurationHint: The time period which is shown in the diagram.

inputserial.format_herf_valid: E-Star HERF format (will be saved converted): {serial}

huawei.SetOffline: Set limit, CAN bus not connected
huawei.LimitHint: Hint: CAN bus not connected voltage limit is 48V-58.5V.

acchargeradmin.EnableHuawei: Enable Huawei R4850G2 on CAN Bus Interface
acchargeradmin.EnableBatterySoCLimits: Use SoC data of a connected battery
acchargeradmin.stopVoltageLimitHint: Maximum charger voltage. Equals battery charge voltage limit. Used for automatic power control and when emergency charging
acchargeradmin.enableVoltageLimitHint:
Automatic power control is disabled if the output voltage is higher then this value and if the output power drops below the minimum output power limit (set below).
Automatic power control is re-enabled if the battery voltage drops below the value set in this field.
acchargeradmin.upperPowerLimitHint: Maximum output power. Used for automatic power control and when emergency charging
acchargeradmin.StopBatterySoCThresholdHint:
To prolong the battery's lifespan, charging can be stopped at a certain SoC level.
Hint: In order to keep the SoC reading accurate, some LiFePO cells must be charged to full capacity regularly.
acchargeradmin.EnableEmergencyCharge: Emergency charge. Battery charged with maximum power if requested by Battery BMS
acchargeradmin.targetPowerConsumptionHint: Postitive values use grid power to charge the battery. Negative values result in early shutdown
